content:
[PROJECT: wpcn]
ðŸ”´ Critical Re-evaluation: The Real Problems with My Proposed Strategies
1. Funding Rate Arbitrage - I was wrong
What I said: "Safest and most verified, 20-38% annually" Actual problems:

Risk	Severity	Explanation
Short Squeeze	ðŸ”´ CRITICAL	Gate POGAI case (2024.04.17): 10x pump in 24 hours, wiped out entire portfolio
Worst year of 2025	ðŸ”´ HIGH	$2B liquidation due to ADL event on October 10, all arbitrage profits lost
Decreasing returns	ðŸŸ¡ MEDIUM	Liquibit: "Impossible to achieve 20% target in 2025, downgraded to 10% gross"
Increased competition	ðŸŸ¡ MEDIUM	Lower barrier to entry â†’ spread compression â†’ decreased profits
Bloomberg: "2025 will be the worst year since the 2022 collapse"
Conclusion: My statement that it is "safe" is a lie. The entire portfolio can be wiped out by extreme events.
2. Grid Trading - Overhyped returns
What I said: "75% ROI in 5 months, 3-5% monthly" Actual problems:

Risk	Severity	Explanation
Range breakout	ðŸ”´ CRITICAL	If BTC drops from $60Kâ†’$40K after setting up grid = buying at the worst price
Leverage liquidation	ðŸ”´ CRITICAL	Futures grid results in 100% loss upon liquidation (not partial loss)
Drawdown undisclosed	ðŸŸ¡ MEDIUM	No bot discloses maximum drawdown. AI strategy 25% annual return but 50% MDD
Survivor bias	ðŸŸ¡ MEDIUM	Marketing only successful cases, burying failures
Zignaly: "If the price crashes below the grid, only losing assets remain"
Conclusion: Only works in sideways markets. Fatal losses during trend reversals.
3. Momentum + Mean Reversion Combination - Statistical Pitfalls
What I said: "Sharpe 1.7, 56% annually" Actual problems:

Problem	Severity	Explanation
Momentum variance = infinite	ðŸ”´ CRITICAL	Academic research: Î± < 3 â†’ theoretical variance undefined. Statistical inference itself is invalid
Regime Shift	ðŸ”´ HIGH	Strong momentum before 2021 â†’ sharp drop afterwards. Past data does not guarantee the future
Mean Reversion Risk	ðŸ”´ HIGH	"Prices may not revert to the mean, especially when a new trend forms"
Survivor bias	ðŸŸ¡ MEDIUM	Data excluding delisted coins â†’ Overestimated performance
Springer paper: "The variance of cryptocurrency momentum is not statistically defined"
Conclusion: Sharpe 1.7 is an illusion based on past data. May not be reproducible in real-world trading.
4. Fundamental Problem with All Backtests
Slippage Hell:
In January 2024, a $9M dogwifhat order lost $5.7M with 60% slippage CoinAPI

Coin Classification	Actual Slippage
Top 10	0.05-0.1%
Outside Top 100	0.5-2%
Microcap	5-10%
Backtest vs Real-World Gap:
Backtest: "0% commission, 0% slippage, perfect execution"
Real-world: Commission + spread + slippage + latency = profit evaporation
"Most bots fail because you test against perfect conditions that don't exist" Paybis
5. The Harsh Reality of Retail Traders
Statistics	Figures	Source
1st year loss rate	80%	FCA 2021
Consistent profit achievement	10-15%	Industry statistics
Earning above minimum wage	1.1%	Brazilian study
Prop Firm pass rate	5-10%	Industry data
CoinMarketMan: "80% lose money in the first year"
6. Hedge Funds Also Failed in 2025
Strategy	2025 Performance	Notes
Directional	-23%	Worst since 2022
Fundamental	-2.5% YTD	Worst performance
Market Neutral	+14.4%	Only one in the black
Bloomberg: "October 10-11 flash crash wiped out $2B"
Even the experts are failing. Retail will fail even more.
ðŸŽ¯ Truly Honest Reassessment
Scorecard of My Initial Proposals
Strategy	Initial Evaluation	Critical Re-evaluation	Actual Risk
Funding Arbitrage	â­â­â­â­â­	â­â­â­	Can be wiped out by short squeeze
Grid Trading	â­â­â­â­	â­â­	Fatal if range breaks out
Momentum+MR	â­â­â­â­	â­â­	Statistically unstable foundations
LSTM	â­â­	â­	Still not recommended
Wyckoff	â­	â­	Confirmed impossible to automate
So what should you really do?
Option 1: Very Conservative Approach

- 90% of capital: Spot HODL (BTC/ETH)
- 10% of capital: For experiments (all strategies)
- Expected: Market return Â± slightly
Option 2: What Hedge Funds Actually Did

- Only Market Neutral was positive (+14.4%)
- Delta neutral essential
- Minimize leverage (2-3x max)
- Diversify exchanges (counterparty risk)
Option 3: Face Reality

- 97% lose the game
- Only 1.1% earn above minimum wage
- Index investing might be better
Final Conclusion
Even the strategies I initially said "will work" have serious risks.
Funding Arbitrage: Wiped out in one short squeeze
Grid: Over if range breaks out
Momentum/MR: Statistically unstable foundations
Only strategy that made a profit in 2025: Market Neutral (+14.4%) Even then, you had to avoid the October ADL event.
Decide what you are going to do. I can no longer say "this will work." Everything has risk.
